meanings.definition: Compete eagerly with someone in order to achieve something.
meanings.sent1: The students will vie for the top spot in the spelling bee.
meanings.sent2: The athletes vie for the gold medal in the competition.
meanings.sent3: The siblings vie playfully to see who can finish their chores first.
meanings.sent4: The companies vie for the attention of potential customers with their marketing strategies.
meanings.sent5: The candidates vie for the voters' support in the upcoming election.

meanings.sent1: She vies to be the best player on the team.
meanings.sent2: The ambitious student vies for the top position in the class.
meanings.sent3: The little boy vies with his friends to be the fastest runner in the race.
meanings.sent4: The artists vying for recognition in the art world.
meanings.sent5: The chef vies to create the most delicious dish in the cooking competition.

meanings.sent1: The teams will vie for the championship title in the final match.
meanings.sent2: The political parties vie for control in the upcoming election.
meanings.sent3: The siblings vie for their parents' attention by showing off their talents.
meanings.sent4: The companies vying for the lucrative contract.
meanings.sent5: The students vie for the highest grade in the class.
